name: Would I Lie to You? Part 1 Online Trivia | Mixed 10 Questions | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which of these statements is WRONG?
questions.correct: An elephant can jump the height of an average man
options: Every day, a baby robin can eat 14 feet of earthworms
Penguins can swim, but are unable to fly
questions.explanation:
An elephant can jump the height of an average man.

	An elephant cannot jump, although most other mammals can. The other three statements are correct.

questions.text: In which part of your body are one quarter of all your bones located?
questions.explanation:
feet.

	An adult has around 206 bones, and 26 of them are located in the foot. There are 27 located in the hand however this option was not available in the question.

questions.text: The man who invented the electric chair followed which of these occupations?
questions.explanation:
dentist.

	The electric chair was invented a dentist, Dr. Albert Southwickin, in 1881.Extract what you can from that!

questions.text: Is this statement correct: "The inventor of the light bulb, Thomas Edison, was scared of the dark"?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	Yes, it's true Edison was afraid of the dark. No wonder he invented the first commercially practical incandescent electric lamp. Edison had this bright idea in 1879.

questions.text: Which of these statements is INCORRECT?
options: A four foot child could fit into the open mouth of a hippopotamus
In one night a mole can dig a 300 feet long tunnel
A camel has three eyelids on each eye
questions.explanation:
Chickens cannot fly.

	Chickens can fly! The longest recorded flight lasted just 13 seconds.

questions.text: Which of the sexes are more likely to be struck by lightning, men or women?
questions.explanation:
men.

	Statistics show that men are struck by lightning six times more often than women.[It must be our magnetic charm guys!]

questions.text: Approximately how many bricks were used to construct the Empire State Building?
questions.explanation:
10 million.

	Construction on the Empire State Building began in 1930.The building is 1,454 feet high, and weighs 365,000 US tons.

questions.text: Which of these statements is NOT true?
questions.correct: bats always turn right when flying out of a cave
options: a starfish can turn its stomach inside out
giraffes can reach their tongues into their ears
questions.explanation:
bats always turn right when flying out of a cave.

	For some reason bats always turn to the left when leaving a cave.And yes, the other three statements are correct!

questions.text: What is depicted on the Nobel Peace Prize medal?
questions.explanation:
three naked men.

	Three naked men with their hands on each other's shoulders are shown on the medal.The Nobel Peace Prize was instigated in 1901 by Swedish chemist Alfred Nobel, the inventor of dynamite.

questions.text: Which creature can survive for several weeks without its head?
questions.explanation:
a cockroach.

	Although a cockroach can live for several days without its head, it eventually dies from starvation.[This quiz is based on information from "strangefacts.com." April 2004]
